title: These Low-Calorie Dinners Are Shockingly Filling — and Tasty
author: Samantha MacAvoy; Rachel Baron
description: Fewer calories does NOT equal less delicious.
cleaned_text: 50 Low-Calorie Meals That Don't Taste Like Diet Food Herbs, spices and sauces go a long way in making these lighter meals taste amazing. [Samantha MacAvoy](/author/225114/samantha-macavoy/)and [Rachel Baron](/author/258829/rachel-baron/) When it comes to low-calorie meals, we're fans of recipes that go hard on flavorful, nutrient-packed ingredients like fresh seafood, colorful veg and filling [whole grains](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/health/diet-nutrition/a20706575/healthy-whole-grains/). Just because a [food is low in calories](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/health/diet-nutrition/g41111495/low-calorie-foods/), after all, doesn't mean that it's a healthy choice. Instead of ditching dairy, carbs, and other high-calorie favorites, we love to load up our plates with high-protein and -fiber ingredients and [healthy fats](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/health/diet-nutrition/g40311661/healthy-fats/) so we never feel deprived — because that's not what low-calorie eating is about. Whether you're practicing [intuitive eating](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/health/diet-nutrition/a26324845/intuitive-eating/) or simply looking to incorporate more nutritious meals into your routine, these [healthy weeknight dinner recipes](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/healthy/g154/healthy-dinner-recipes/) are the best of both worlds: low in calories and delicious. Love chicken parm? Tacos? How about Caesar salad? We've got it all. You can rest easy knowing that each of these meals is under 500 calories per serving, and feature small amounts of foods like steak, pasta, and — our forever favorite — parmesan cheese. We've also got a ton of delicious [vegetarian options](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/healthy/g908/vegetarian-recipes/) and [vegan dishes](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/healthy/g807/vegan-recipes/) in our mix. There's no bland 'diet food' here: just nourishing whole foods, with a few treats thrown in. Any one of these recipes can be served on their own, or with one or two [healthy side dishes](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/healthy/g721/healthy-side-dishes/) or [healthy desserts](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/dessert/g478/no-guilt-desserts/) (or both) for a heartier meal. Having a low-calorie weeknight dinner that fits into your diet plan just got a whole lot easier. Seared Salmon with Charred Green Beans Here's what you need for this recipe: salmon, green beans, garlic, capers and red chile. That's it! Get the [Seared Salmon with Charred Green Beans recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/a38540033/seared-salmon-with-charred-green-beans-recipe/). Broccoli "Steaks" with Spicy Tomato Jam Not only is Broccoli one of our favorite [low-calorie foods](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/health/diet-nutrition/g41111495/low-calorie-foods/), but it's incredibly versatile as well. Seared in a skillet like steak and topped with crispy breadcrumbs, this is broccoli you eat with a fork and knife. Get the [Broccoli "Steaks" with Spicy Tomato Jam recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/a38685461/broccoli-steaks-with-spicy-tomato-jam-recipe/). RELATED: [7 Health Benefits, According to Registered Dietitians](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/health/diet-nutrition/a19500502/broccoli-nutrition/#:~:text=Support%20a%20healthy%20heart%3A%20Broccoli,in%20supporting%20a%20healthy%20heart.) Air Fryer Squash Soup Ever tried soup in an [air fryer](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/appliances/a24630295/best-air-fryers-reviews/)? The even heat roasts squash, carrots and aromatics perfectly before blending. Get the [Air Fryer Squash Soup recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/a38541119/air-fryer-squash-soup-recipe/). RELATED: [57 Easy Air Fryer Recipes That Are Fast and Super Delicious](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/g34521867/air-fryer-recipes/) Sheet Pan Fish and Vegetables Whether you're sticking to a [1,200 calorie diet plan](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/health/diet-nutrition/g4351/1200-calorie-diet-plan/) or just trying to incorporate more fish into your dinners, this easy sheet pan fish is light, flavorful perfection. Get the [Sheet Pan Fish and Vegetables recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/a38388248/sheet-pan-fish-and-vegetables-recipe/). Spicy Shrimp Lettuce Wraps Set out a tray of healthy shrimp lettuce wraps made with veggies and fresh herbs for dinner tonight! Get the [Spicy Shrimp Lettuce Wraps recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/easy/a37198848/shrimp-lettuce-wraps-recipe/). RELATED: [28 Healthy and Delicious Ways to Eat All the Shrimp](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/healthy/g572/healthy-shrimp-recipes/) White Bean and Kale Toasts Not just for breakfast, toast is a totally acceptable dinner when topped with creamy beans and tender kale. Get the [White Bean and Kale Toasts recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/a38685594/white-bean-and-kale-toasts-recipe/). Garam Masala Roasted Chicken and Cauliflower Garam masala adds warming heat and lots of flavor to this simple chicken-and-veggies meal. Get the [Garam Masala Roasted Chicken and Cauliflower recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/easy/a38541420/garam-masala-roasted-chicken-and-cauliflower-recipe/). RELATED: [60 Best Healthy Chicken Recipes That Are Easy to Make for Dinner](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/healthy/g4056/healthy-chicken-dinners/) Roasted Cauliflower Tacos It's (vegetarian) taco night! With chili, coriander and cumin-spiced cauliflower as the filling, you won't meat. Get the [Roasted Cauliflower Tacos recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/a37223730/cauliflower-tacos-recipe/). Best-Ever Marinated Flank Steak Fresh orange and lime juice helps tenderize and season this steak without a ton of excess sugar or oil. Balsamic Glazed Pork with Roasted Butternut Squash Add a sweet-sour touch to juicy pork tenderloin with an easy balsamic, honey and thyme glaze. Get the [Balsamic Glazed Roasted Butternut Squash recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/a38685746/balsamic-glazed-pork-with-roasted-butternut-squash-recipe/). RELATED: [37 Best Butternut Squash Recipes That Are Easy to Make for Fall](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/g767/butternut-squash-recipes/) Sheet Pan Chicken Fajitas Try fajitas on a sheet pan for easy prep and even easier cleanup. Get the [Sheet Pan Chicken Fajitas recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/a38666678/sheet-pan-chicken-fajitas-recipe/). RELATED: [18 Easy Sheet Pan Dinners That Make Cleanup a Breeze](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/easy/g30270283/sheet-pan-dinners/) Shrimp Ceviche Packed with citrus juices, honey, shallot, jalapeño and ginger, this refreshing light dinner or appetizer is big on flavor. Get the [Shrimp Ceviche recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/a36491713/shrimp-ceviche-recipe/). Cauliflower parsley and thyme make a tasty, crunchy topper to this silkiest-ever soup. Get the [Creamy Cauliflower Soup with Almond-Thyme Gremolata recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/healthy/a47225/cauliflower-soup-recipe/). Fiery Pork Lettuce Wraps Gochujang adds impressive heat to juicy pork tenderloin. Cool it down with crisp lettuce and cooked rice. Get the [Fiery Pork Lettuce Wraps recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/a38538435/pork-lettuce-wraps-recipe/). Air Fryer Stuffed Chicken Creamy goat cheese and crispy prosciutto add lots of flavor — but few calories — to this weeknight wonder. Get the [Air Fryer Stuffed Chicken recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/a38473659/air-fryer-cheese-stuffed-chicken-recipe/). Tandoori Chicken A yogurt marinade pretty much guarantees juicy, tender chicken legs in this tandoori spiced recipe. Plus, air frying gets you crisp, golden-brown skin with a fraction of the oil used for roasting. Get the [Tandoori Chicken recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/a38868102/tandoori-chicken-recipe/). California Roll Salad This deconstructed sushi bar classic keeps the calorie count low with a combo of brown rice and crisp Boston lettuce as the base. Get the [California Roll Salad recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/healthy/a39428742/california-roll-salad-recipe/). Shakshuka Try scooping up this rich tomato-and-egg stew with crusty bread, and then tell us you don't love breakfast for dinner. Get the [Shakshuka recipe](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/a34908201/easy-shakshuka-recipe/). Paprika Chicken with Crispy Chickpeas and Tomatoes With tons of fiber from the chickpeas and lean protein from the chicken breast, this one-pan dish is a meal in itself — though you can totally serve it with rice or couscous if you prefer. Get the [Paprika Chicken With Crispy Chickpeas and Tomatoes](https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/food-recipes/a38666977/paprika-chicken-with-crispy-chickpeas-and-tomatoes-recipe/) recipe. Samantha (she/her) is an Assistant Editor in the Good Housekeeping Test Kitchen, where she writes about tasty recipes, must-try food products and top-tested secrets for home cooking success. She has taste-tasted hundreds of products and recipes since joining GH in 2020 (tough job!). A graduate of Fordham University, she considers the kitchen to be her happiest place.
